**Title:**
*The Highest Celestial Palace of the Moon, Supreme Dark Lord of Filial Dao, the Soul-Treasuring Immortal King’s Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence*
*(Commonly abbreviated as the *Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence*)*

**Author Unknown**, a Daoist scripture of the *Pure Clarity* sect from the Song-Yuan period.
Commentary by *Fei Fei* (傅飞), a Yuan-era transmission.
Ten volumes.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daozang*, *Dongxuan* (Mystic Primordial) section, *Methods* category.

---

**Preface to *The Highest Celestial Palace of the Moon, Supreme Dark Lord of Filial Dao, the Soul-Treasuring Immortal King’s Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence***

The Preface states:

The **Supreme Ultimate**—the loftiest origin—is the **Azure Heaven** of the first beginning.
It lies **five thousand li** beyond the palaces of the Sun and Moon,
where the **divine mechanisms** of the Dao unfold in radiant distinction,
yet remain difficult to discern.

Does Heaven’s Way return?
This is the **dim and silent void**, beyond naming.

When the **Imperial Sovereign** issues the **Shocking** (震),
it is called the **Azure Heaven** of the first beginning.
Heaven’s creation was yet in **primordial chaos**,
before the Five Phases had fully manifested—
it could not yet be seen.

Thus it is said: **"Five thousand li beyond the palaces of the Sun and Moon."**

The **pure essence of the Sun** is the **Supreme Yang**,
the **pure essence of the Moon** is the **Supreme Yin**—
this interplay of **Yin and Yang** is the **Dao**.

Its waxing and waning have their seasons,
its swiftness and slowness follow their measures.
The **divine mechanisms** operate under the **unfathomable governance of Yin and Yang**.
Thus it is said: **"The divisions are manifest, yet not easily distinguished."**

The **Celestial Sovereign**, moved by pity for the **premature deaths** of living beings,
summoned the **Two Celestial Lords of the Sun and Moon Palaces**
to expound the **Four Great Methods**:
the **Soul-Treasuring Method (灵宝大法)**,
the **Yellow Essence Method (黄素法)**,
the **Pure Clarity Method (净明法)**,
and the **Method of Salvation (度人法)**—
each one in turn.

When **Heaven and Earth bind and restrain**,
all things refine into **purity**.
When **male and female merge their essences**,
all things generate anew—
none of this is without the **collision and transformation of Yin and Yang qi**.

Yet when **internal injury** strikes the **Seven Essences**,
and **external malevolence** assaults the **Six Qi**,
then the **plagues of Yin and Yang** take hold,
and living beings suffer the **misery of untimely death**.

Thus the **Celestial Sovereign** summoned the **Two Celestial Officials of the Sun and Moon**,
declaring that **only the most refined essence of Yin and Yang qi**
could **revive the dying, restore the fallen, and reanimate the stiffened**—
granting them **full years of life** and **eternal longevity**.

Yet among these, the **Soul-Treasuring Method** is the **root of the Dao**,
the **Yellow Essence Method** is the **repository of life**,
the **Pure Clarity Method** is the **source of innate nature**,
and the **Method of Salvation** is the **gateway to the Dao**.

The **Dao descends in its proper order**—
thus it is taught.

When the **Law** was expounded,
the **multitude of True Ones** gathered in assembly.

The **Dao Sovereign**, the **Supreme Celestial King**, ascended to the **Hall of the Penetrating Spirit**, seated upon the **Jade Pivot Throne**, and reverently imparted this scripture.

Some may be lost in **delusion**, squandering the **true for the false**.
Yet return to the **original source**, and the **true abides eternally**—
thus the **multitude of True Ones** gathered in assembly.

For there exists a **True Sovereign**—
the **Dao Sovereign**, the **Supreme Celestial King**, is He.

**Penetrating** like water’s depth, reaching all things,
**Spiritual** like fire’s transmission, responding to all things.
Ascending to the **Hall of the Penetrating Spirit**,
seated, the **transformations of Dao-Law** become boundless.
Seated upon the **Jade Pivot Throne**,
the **pure Yang essence** is refined and given form.
Reverently imparting this scripture—
how could one dare neglect it?

Its text is **broad as a yard**,
yet this book shines with **intermingled Yellow and White Essences**,
its radiant bristles dazzling,
illuminating the **Moon Palace**.

Thus it was entrusted to him,
and he was named **Moon Palace’s Supreme Sovereign of the Great Yin,
Pious Dao King of the Soul-Treasuring, Pure Clarity, Yellow Essence**.

While the **Pure Clarity Soul-Treasuring Method** was entrusted to the **Sun Palace’s Supreme Sovereign of the Great Yang,
Pious Dao King of the Bright Sovereign, Soul-Treasuring, Pure Clarity**.

The *Yijing* says:
*"Things intermingle, hence called **pattern (wen)**."*
The **qi of Yin-Yang, firm and yielding**, intertwines to form **pattern**,
and thus the **heavens and earth revolve in cycles**.
Hence its text is **broad and long, a yard in measure**—
**yellow earth in hue**, governed by the **spleen**.
**White**, the color of **metal and water**, governed by the **kidneys**.
At the **receipt of life’s mandate**, the **spleen and kidneys** are the **root of original qi and penetrating qi**.
While the **fetus nurtures within the womb**, it depends upon the mother’s body.
Thus the **intermingled Yellow and White Essences** radiate,
illuminating the **Moon Palace**.
Yet when **inherited nature is perfected**,
it rests upon the **father’s essence**.
The **Pure Clarity Treasure Method** belongs to the **Sun Palace’s Great Yang**.

These two scriptures are **profound and subtle**, beyond comprehension.
They can **reward sovereigns and parents**,
can **forge the Great Elixir**,
can **subdue calamities and demons**.
Those who **behold them** dissolve stagnation,
those who **hear them** are cured of illness,
those who **carry them** attain longevity.

The *Cold Clarity Yellow Essence Scripture*—
its **principles are subtle**, its **Dao concise**, its **meaning profound and difficult to fathom**.
For the **inner** is the **mirror of the outer**,
and **one body** is the **embodiment of heaven and earth’s reverence**.

「When the **Heavenly Sovereign** aligns with the **spirit**,
and the mind extends it outward,
then **loyalty and filial piety** can repay **sovereigns and parents**.
To **extract lead and mercury**,
to **refine water and fire**,
and to **verify them externally**,
then **alchemy** can be achieved.

Medicine forged by **fire** is the **reversal of qi**.
Yet this **guides the common spirits**—the **perverse qi** of demons.
And this **restores the upright stagnation**—the **suppressed qi** of calamities.
Hence, those who **behold the flowing qi** dissolve their afflictions,
for **excessive qi** is their undoing—thus, those who **hear the central qi** are cured.

As for those who **guard the primordial qi** without loss,
even if they endure with **heaven and earth** as eternal companions,
it can be done.
Thus it is said:
*"Those who carry it attain longevity."*
Those who **grasp its meaning** achieve **transcendence**.

**Embracing the harmonious transformations of yin and yang**,
**illuminating the celestial movements of stars and constellations**—
the **Four Turnings of the Northern Dipper**,
the **Eastern and Western divisions** governing the **cosmic axis**.
**Qi’s responses and interactions**,
the **early and late** separations of **cosmic candidates**.
None but those who have already **obtained the Pure Clarity Treasure Method**
can easily comprehend this.

The **transformations of yin and yang** are **activated by qi’s resonance**.
The **Four Turnings of the Northern Dipper** revolve **by the void’s operation**.
The **eastern and western divisions** govern the **cosmic axis by qi’s penetration**.
**Unfolding and extending it**,
it **spans the ages without end**.
**Condensing and gathering it**,
it **shortens the years to mere moments**.
None but those who **exhaust the principles and perfect their nature**
can truly partake in this.

Thus it is said:
*"Without the responses of cosmic candidates,
and the early and late separations,
none but those who have already obtained the Pure Clarity Treasure Method
can easily comprehend this."*

The **Yellow Emperor’s Essence Scripture on Human Dao** states:
*"All who study the **Yellow Essence Scripture**,
by **aligning the Five Qi with the Primordial**,
and **converging the Three Yang at the Vertex**,
may either **ascend to sainthood** or **transcend to transcendence**.
The **young**, with **thousand-day devotion**, may achieve greatness.
The **middle-aged**, with **thousand-day cultivation**, may still attain fulfillment.
The **elderly**, with **thousand-day perseverance**, may yet establish merit.
All disciples, once **obtaining the method**,
should **treasure the fleeting moments of day and month**,
forging **longevity’s foundation**—none surpass this in enduring calculation.*

At **human birth**, the **primordial qi** resides at the **navel**.
Yet the **Five Phases’ qi** disperse through the **five viscera**.
**Governed by the Three Palaces**,
they are the **Elixir Field**, the **Crimson Palace**, and the **Mud Pellet**.

Mortals, **lost in desires**, fail to **gather and preserve**,
thus their **Five Qi scatter**, and their **primordial qi perishes**.
**Ascension and descent misalign**,
and the **Three Palaces are obstructed**.
**Refinement and dissipation exhaust**,
so **premature death** ensues.

Studying the **Yellow Essence Scripture**,
one must **direct the Five Qi to the Primordial**,
so that the **Golden Elixir** is perfected.
And **converge the Three Yang at the Vertex**,
filling the **Marrow Sea** with abundance.
Some **ascend in spirit**, their **vital functions unbounded**,
and **enter sainthood**.
Others **shed their mortal shells**, **resolving the corpse**,
**transcending the dusty net**,
and **ascend to transcendence**.

The **young**, with **qi and blood firm and intact**,
if they **proceed steadily**, may achieve greatness.
The **middle-aged**, with **qi and blood diminished**,
if they **act with vigor**, may still attain fulfillment.
The **elderly**, with **qi and blood decayed**,
if they **strive with strength**, may yet establish merit.
It requires **thousand days’ duration**,
for **numbers begin at one**,
**stand at two**,
and **complete at three**.
**Accumulated over three years**,
they **span the times** and achieve **fullness of numbers**—
thus their success is ensured.
Learners who **realize the swiftness of sun and moon**,
and **know the fleeting nature of each moment**,
should **devote their efforts here**.

All who study the **Yellow Essence Scripture** must **prioritize loyalty and filial piety**.
The **loyal and filial**,
with **upright and honest hearts**,
**bearing qi that is temperate and respectful**,
cannot be swayed by **right and wrong**—
**perverse desires** cannot enter them.
**Ten Virtues are complete**,
**Five Transgressions are dissolved**,
and within their **single heart**,
**external defilements** cannot **disturb**—
naturally, they **achieve perfection**, and **ultimately succeed**.
Thus, the **adepts of the Yellow Essence** regard **loyalty and filial piety** as their foundation.

Moreover, the **loyal and filial**,
**serving their parents internally**,
**serving their sovereigns externally**,
with **no guilt nor fear**,
can **reach the profound and bright**.
Their **names and deeds** are **recorded**,
their **merits at the Elixir Platform** are **preserved in the Purple Register**.
Coupled with **Daoist study**,
they are **like fine gold meeting the forge**,
or **jewel meeting the chisel**—
few are those who, **already carved**, fail to become **vessels of excellence**.

**Loyalty and filial piety** derive their names
from **serving sovereigns and parents**,
all **resting upon upright hearts**, **honest judgments**, **bearing temperate qi**, and **respectful demeanor**.
Yet in **serving the public**,
**honest judgment** is paramount.
In **serving one’s parents**,
**respectful demeanor** is paramount.
**Honest judgment** brings **clarity**—
thus **right and wrong** cannot sway them.
**Respectful demeanor** fosters **abundance**—
thus **perverse desires** cannot enter them.
From **loyalty and filial piety**, they **extend outward**:
**Wealth** becomes **generosity**.
**Speech** becomes **caution**.
**Dwelling** is **spacious and tolerant**.
**Conduct** is **regulated by ritual**.
**Words** are **sincere in truth**.
Thus the **Ten Virtues are complete**.

**Sovereign and subject** uphold **justice**—
do not **reverse the cosmic order**.
**Parent and child** share **affection**—
do not **reverse their natural divisions**.
**Husband and wife** observe **distinctions**—
do not **reverse their harmonious accord**.
**Elders and juniors** follow **sequence**—
do not **reverse their ritual precedence**.
**Friends** keep **trust**—
do not **reverse their hearts of communion**.
Thus the **Five Transgressions are dissolved**.

With **one heart pure and serene**,
like **water clarified and clean**,
how can **external filth** **disturb** it?
Then, in **Daoist study**, can there be any **failure**?

The *Scripture on Guiding Others* says:
*"All heavens record human deeds of virtue and vice,
without the slightest loss.
When the **Ten Virtues are complete**,
and the **Five Transgressions are dissolved**,
then the **register of evils** has no names,
and the **register of merits** is fully inscribed.
The **Purple Register** of the **Elixir Platform**—
what more need be doubted?"*

*The Rites* say:
*"Jade unpolished does not become a vessel.
Humans unlearned do not know the Dao."*
*The Commentary* says:
*"If gold is in the crucible,
only the smith can cast it.
With **inner conduct refined**,
and **Daoist study added**,
is it not like fine gold and precious jade—
**polished to enhance their utility**,
**carved to perfect their beauty**?
**Dryfowl and Hu Lian**—
who would say such vessels are **difficult to forge**?"*

「Now, the disciples may be divided into those who enter public office, those who serve the people while in office, those whose parents are both alive and honored, those who have lost both parents, and those who are the sole support of their parents yet face partiality. When reflecting on their past, they must carefully examine their intentions.

Those who tread the path of public service must understand the true purpose of their office.
Those who wield the people’s strength must know the proper way to serve them.
Those who have living parents must recognize that the debt of filial piety cannot be repaid with tears, nor can the dead be consoled with lamentations.
Only those who have lost both parents know the unbearable weight of grief.
Yet if they can grasp that those who turn toward the Dao will succeed, transcending worldly records and rising above ordinary status, their teachings will be universally followed. Extend this to the world, and there will be none who cannot be reached.

The loyal will revere it to its utmost; the filial will follow it to its utmost. If one embodies both reverence and filial duty without failing, then those in public service will labor night and day without rest to serve their superiors, and with kindness and benevolence to nurture those beneath them—thus knowing the true purpose of their office.

By following the Dao of Heaven, sharing the benefits of Earth, moderating oneself and regulating expenditures, and remembering one’s sovereign and parents, one knows the proper way to serve the people.
The body, flesh, and bones are received from one’s parents, and the debt of gratitude is boundless as the sky. Filial children cherish each day because they fear failing to repay this debt, even in death.
Without a father, where would one find refuge?
Without a mother, where would one find support?
When leaving home, they must protect against cold and heat;
When returning, they must guard against harm.
Those who, after joy, fear what follows—
this is the sorrow of remembering the dead.

*The Classic of Filial Piety* says:
*"To establish oneself in the Dao and act accordingly, to earn a name in future generations, and to honor one’s parents—this is the ultimate expression of filial piety. But if one can turn toward the Dao, succeed in its practice, transcend worldly bonds, escape the cycles of fate, attain extraordinary status, and be ranked among the immortals, then what greater fulfillment of filial duty could there be?"*

All who study *The Yellow and White* must prioritize **frugality and caution**.
The frugal and cautious have no greed or desire, yet maintain steadfast principles.
Without greed or desire, one naturally upholds virtue.
With virtue upheld, there is no shame or defilement.
Without anger or agitation, one avoids suffering.
Without suffering, one can practice the Dao.
Once the Dao is practiced, one naturally becomes expansive and tolerant.
In ease, in stillness, in emptiness, in tranquility, in longevity, in constancy—
only then can success be achieved.

The contented see gain and ponder justice, thus having no greed.
The cautious speak and act without recklessness, thus maintaining virtue.
Greed is enticed by external things;
virtue is rooted in the self.
Interaction with others may lead to conflict,
and daily battles of the mind can never be won by clinging to the form.
Thus it is said:
*"Without greed, one naturally upholds virtue.
With virtue upheld, there is no shame."*

Those who indulge in drink and force themselves to drink cannot escape **drunken excess**.
Those who dwell in damp, low places cannot avoid **moisture’s harm**.
Thus, with virtue upheld, there is no shame.

If three calls go unheeded, one must resort to harsh words.
If strictness is pushed too far, one will inevitably harbor resentment.
Thus, without shame, one avoids anger.

When profit and harm clash, flames arise abundantly,
and common folk are consumed by them.
Thus, without anger, one avoids suffering.

The serene and effortless are the foundation of **Daoist virtue**.
All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures* must focus on harmonizing their nature.
The nature’s operation mirrors still water:
like its reflections, it accepts all without favor,
yet cannot distinguish right from wrong.
Act when necessary, rest when necessary—
to follow this naturally is to grasp its essence.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they understand the principles of conduct, must also learn to guard them.
The method of guarding lies in contemplating:
where did this body originate?
Where will it return?
Within this coming and going,
if one recognizes its source,
one will naturally attain **spiritual insight**—
and thus the Dao of the immortals will be fulfilled.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they understand the origin and return, must strive with determination.
Striving is not difficult,
but preserving constancy is.
What is meant by the difficulty of preserving constancy?
When food and clothing press in, greed follows—**this is the first**.
When superiors impose restraints, worldly affairs swirl around—**this is the second**.
When children and spouse entangle one, worries and calculations arise—**this is the third**.
When fame and gain ensnare one, they refuse to let go—**this is the fourth**.
When illness torments one, their practice remains incomplete—**this is the fifth**.
When teachers are chosen carelessly, their methods are not properly absorbed—**this is the sixth**.
When debates arise, doubts multiply, and one cannot remain focused—**this is the seventh**.
When resolve wavers, diligence fades, and one forgets their initial efforts—**this is the eighth**.
When time slips away, success cannot be achieved—**this is the ninth**.
All these circumstances lead to **deviation from the Dao**.

When encountering such trials, one must persist with effort, seeking not immediate gratification, but ultimate fulfillment—
then success will be attained.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they grasp the way of constancy, must also know the methods of attainment.
What is meant by attainment?
To know Heaven and Earth,
to know the Four Seasons,
to know the Sun and Moon,
to know the Five Phases,
to distinguish Water and Fire,
to harmonize Dragon and Tiger,
to understand alchemical medicines,
to master lead and mercury,
and to perfect the techniques of **distillation and sublimation**, as well as **revolving the cinnabar furnace**.
Then, the arts of refining the form,
the methods of returning to the **Primordial Origin**,
the trials of **demonic obstacles**,
and the enlightenment of **verification**—
all will be fully realized.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures* know the attainment of Heaven and Earth,
yet do not yet know the mysteries of Heaven and Earth.
What are the mysteries of Heaven and Earth?
They are the origin of one’s parents.
Heaven’s black essence descends like a father’s **vital seed**.
Earth’s **qi** ascends in response like a mother’s **transforming blood**.
Within this union,
this body is formed.»

「The Dao of Heaven and Earth, being both vast and enduring, lies in the interplay of **movement and stillness**, and in the **law of repose within motion**. Knowing repose within motion reveals the Dao of Heaven and Earth.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures* know the **four seasons**, yet do not grasp their **mechanism**. What is the mechanism of the four seasons?
A human life spans a hundred years—from youth to vigor, it is the time of **weakness and infancy**. From vigor to the decline of life at sixty, it is the time of **senility and decay**, the moment of **corruption and failure**.
Thus, a single human body embodies the **seasons of Heaven and Earth**.
Therefore, the **seasons of one’s own body** are rare and precious,
while the **hours within a day** are even more fleeting.
Understanding their mechanism,
the youth should apply themselves diligently,
knowing the **seasons of their own body**.
No moment should be wasted,
knowing the **hours within a day**.
Within the body, there are **years**; within the years, **months**; within the months, **days**; within the days, **hours**.
Only then can one align with the **Great Dao**.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, having known the **solar and lunar**, must also comprehend their **numerical correspondence**.
*The Scripture of Purity and Stillness* states:
*The Great Dao is formless*, yet it gives birth to Heaven and Earth.
*The Great Dao is nameless*, yet it governs the **cycling of the sun and moon**.
Silently recalling the **Two Principles**—
the interplay of **yin and yang**—
assists in fulfilling the **functions of day and night**.
Thus, when **Chaos first divides**,
the **Primordial Yellow and Dark** distinguish their positions.
The forms of Heaven and Earth
are like **joined vessels**.
Within the **Six Extremes**,
they resemble **a single egg**.
The **palaces of the sun and moon**,
ascending and descending by their **numerical order**,
are like the **vital essence (魄)** of a human.
Therefore, the adept
must **nurture the spirit to govern the vital essence (魄)**,
and must not fail to know the **birth and setting of the sun and moon**.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, having known the **Five Phases**,
yet do not grasp their **proper application**.
They **generate and restrain** one another,
as **father and son**,
as **husband and wife**,
as **lord and subject**,
as **male and female**.
The human **Five Zang and Six Fu organs**,
each correspond by analogy,
while the human body contains all **Five Phases** in full.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, within the **Five Phases**,
know **water and fire**.
Yet how does one **discriminate between them**?
The **kidneys** and **heart**,
eight inches and four divisions apart,
mark the **fixed positions of water and fire**.
The **vital essence (氣)** and **body fluids (液)**,
the **Great Sources** of **yin and yang**,
are the **interplay of water and fire**.
The **heart produces fluids**,
descending from the **lung’s fluids** to the heart.
These **fluids** are the **yin**, the **home** of the **transforming blood**.
The **kidneys produce qi**,
ascending from the **kidney’s qi** to the heart.
This **qi** is the **yang**, the **chamber** of the **vital seed**.
Sometimes it flows **from above to below**,
sometimes **from below to above**,
as the **Two Essences** unite,
thus it is called **True Fire, True Water**.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered the **union of Dragon and Tiger**,
must yet clarify the **nature of the elixirs**.
For **elixirs** have **internal and external** forms.
The **Internal Elixir**—
its **medicinal ingredients** arise from the **heart and kidneys**,
which all humans possess,
yet one must seek the **Sacred Embryo**,
whereby **True Qi** is generated.
Within the **Qi**, there is **Qi**,
like **Dragon’s Pearl** or **Ox’s Yellow**,
rooted in the **Primordial Yellow Sprout**.
Once the **Internal Elixir** is formed,
one can **store external medicines** in the **breathing exercises (呵呼)**,
such as the **fusion of lead and mercury**,
or the **refinement of cinnabar and silver essence**.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered the **union of Dragon and Tiger**,
and discriminated the **medicinal ingredients**,
must also explain the **nature of lead and mercury**.
Within **cinnabar**, there is **mercury**,
comparable to the **Yang Dragon**.
Within **lead**, the **silver essence**,
comparable to the **Yin Tiger**.
**Lead** is the **mother** of **silver**,
**mercury** is the **child** of **cinnabar**.
When **lead and mercury** unite,
**refinement and tempering** naturally occur.
Placed in the **alchemical furnace (鼎器)**,
paired with the **medicinal decoctions (药饵)**,
nourished without deficiency,
then the **Golden Elixir** can be attained.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered **lead and mercury**,
must also know the **methods of distillation and sublimation**.
**Distillation (抽)** means **to extract**,
**sublimation (添)** means **to supplement**.
The **principles of extraction and supplementation**
are the **foundation of transformation**.
Thus, Heaven and Earth—
**yin and yang** ascending and descending—
**transform the Six Qi**.
The **sun and moon cycling**—
**transform the Nine and Six** (i.e., the **Nine Stars of the Sun and Six Stars of the Moon**).
If one does not grasp the **mechanism of Heaven and Earth**,
then **True Lead** will scatter in an instant.
This must be carefully remembered.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered the **principles of distillation and sublimation**,
must also know the **operations of the Cinnabar Furnace (河车)**.
What is the **Cinnabar Furnace**?
There is the **Great Cinnabar Furnace**,
the **Small Cinnabar Furnace**,
and the **Purple Cinnabar Furnace**.
The **Cinnabar Furnace** is the **orthodox Qi of the North**,
constantly revolving,
encompassing the **beginning of yin and yang**,
and **matching odd and even pairs** in succession.
Internally, it **concentrates the spirit**,
then **harvests medicines from Nature**,
advances **True Qi’s Fire**,
**supplements mercury and extracts lead**,
and this is the **first matter of the Small Cinnabar Furnace**.
When one **passes the Three Passes with a single strike**,
directly transcending to the **Inner Palace**,
**retrieving and refining** the **posterior and anterior**,
**nurturing the upper and lower**,
while the **Great Elixir of the Yellow Court** gradually forms,
this is the **Great Cinnabar Furnace**.

When the **Great and Small Cinnabar Furnaces** are both in operation,
and the **art is fully realized**,
the **form and Qi are unharmed**,
the **Dao is harmonized**,
then it is called the **Purple Cinnabar Furnace**.
With these **Three Furnaces** mastered,
all take meaning from the **operations of revolving**.
Thus, **refining the form**
is the **art of Primordial Inner Observation (元内观)**,
all within oneself.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having heard the **precepts and prohibitions**,
must **diligently uphold them**.
Time passes swiftly like a flowing stream,
and the **pills of Qi** and **form** dissipate,
like **burning flames melting into embers**.
Once the **flames are extinguished**,
they **must** be **quenched**.
Each should **early exert their efforts**,
so that the **Six Relatives** may harmonize,
and one may **ascend to the Six Heavens**,
while the **Nine Clans** receive blessings.

From the **origin of the Qi and pulse pathways**,
one must **obtain the smooth path**.

No glutinous rice—no demonic stench,
Natural purity returns to the central court.
Ten years within the heavenly kitchen’s refinement,
Morning and evening, feasts arrive in procession.
Moreover, restraining desire preserves essence,
No craving for the three repugnant or five pungent.
The Supreme’s medicine is in the prior classic,
Further sacrificial rites require meat and blood.
To repel the nine ranks of spirits,
The nine ranks take worm-like form.
Mixing meat with medicine dissolves their shape,
*Fu-ling* and hempseed—two refined essences.
Forming thin porridge at dawn,
One dose per decade—
One dose dissolves the nine ranks like ice.

Yellow Silk says:
Abstinence cannot grant longevity,
But it can refine spirit and attain immortality.
To attain immortality requires virtue’s function,
Function demands years of cultivation—
Thus, elixirs seek longevity,
Abstinence aims for ascension.
Function lies in dual accumulation,
Practice must be complete in both.
Filial piety hides within the heart’s knowing,
Cultivation and refinement perfect conduct.
Without slacking in practice,
A single leap returns to the Azure Sky.

Ascension has its method,
Not in bodily flight.
Flight while bearing the elixir’s decree—
Only then is one a true great immortal.
If only skilled in rising,
This is called the Empty-Walking Immortal.
Riding on pretense or falsehood—
This discerns our true function.

Yellow Silk says:
The true Dao originates from the mind’s intent.
All false perceptions arise from the mind itself.
As with abstinence—
Years pass without hunger.
Seven days without food—
Illness comes, and death follows.
Man can endure years without hunger,
Or perish in seven days.
Life and death differ,
Yet their methods are the same.
Not hungry, not desiring—
This comes from the true and real.
Talismans and spell-water
Also stem from thought and deliberation.
Spirit and *qi* in harmony—
Naturally, they fill and overflow.
Thoughts of death arise from false perception.
Five flavors’ fragrance—
Greed’s saliva overflows.
Spirit disperses, causing hunger and thirst.
Truly, all human action—
Some true, some errant—
Must be approached with caution.
Like

If sweat does not originate from the hand,
then from where does sweat come?
Thus, sweat arises from the mind,
while evil arises from the hand.
Mind and hand in resonance—
naturally, sweat emerges.

Again, the fragrance of fine aromas—
seeing them provokes swallowing.
Filth and impurity in drink—
hearing them provokes vomiting.
Swallowing and vomiting originally arise from the fragrance of fine aromas and filth.
Thus, before tasting fine aromas or filth,
one assumes they do not enter the body,
believing that swallowing and vomiting come from within.
Then fine aromas are not vomited,
and filth is not swallowed—
thus, fine aromas and filth also arise from the mind’s thought.

Since it is known that thought originates from the mind,
one must guard against the mind’s false thoughts.
This is what is meant by thought—
as such.

---
**The Sacred Scripture of the Yellow Silk, Volume Eight Complete**
**The Sacred Scripture of the Yellow Silk, Volume Nine**

Yellow Silk says:
The Celestial Palace exists within the body—
yet it is not the body itself;
The Underworld exists within the body—
yet it is not the body itself.
The Celestial Palace exists outside—
yet it is not outside;
The Underworld exists outside—
yet it is not outside.
If it is neither within the body nor outside,
then where does it reside?
Ten thousand attachments give rise to thought,
and thought truly originates from the mind.
Arising from the mind, it is as if the scene lies outside.
Just as in a sealed chamber,
where no other things exist,
the flowers outside the chamber
are unseen within.
Yet when one closely contemplates the flowers before them,
the floral scene appears before the eyes.
Thus, the Celestial Palace and Underworld
enter clearly through false perception.

Yellow Silk says:
The desire between male and female
arises from yin and yang.
Within yin and yang,
the distinction of male and female emerges.
A beautiful husband and ugly wife—
though they do not please each other;
A beautiful wife and ugly husband—
it is the same.
The difference between beauty and ugliness
lies in the male and female distinction.
Some find each other pleasing,
others do not—
thus, the desire of male and female
is like beauty and ugliness.
The perception of beauty and ugliness
does not depend on male and female.
Once, a blind man
coupled with an ugly woman,
yet found her as beautiful as a fair one.
Thus, the perception of beauty and ugliness
is like the distinction of male and female.
Therefore, the so-called male and female distinction
is irrelevant.
The mind’s desire for beauty arises from lust,
lust arises from lewdness,
and lewdness’s fluids intermingle,
rooted in false perception.
Controlled by false perception,
the essence is not true—
this is called *Jingming* (Pure Clarity).

Yellow Silk says:
Fluids arise from the mind,
the mind arises from fluids—
the thought of mind and fluids
is where they originate.
The fluids of tears and mucus,
the kinship of flesh and bone.
When the close one dies,
one weeps before seeing them.
When the distant one dies,
one covers their nose and passes by.
Though tears and mucus are one,
proximity and distance lie in the mind.
The mind’s thought generates fluids,
fluids transform into tears and mucus.

Yellow Silk says:
To be steadfast and responsive—
steadfastness is unity.
Responsiveness is thought.
Unity in what is contemplated
is the true and real.
The *qi* within the mind
originates from the formless.
The bone at the crown
is form and thus firm.
The thought of the body’s *qi*
shatters this firm bone.
Bone is black, void within—
bone opens due to *qi*.
*Qi* is formless,
yet thought makes it pass through.
As with false thought,
how could the bone open?
Pressing the crown with the hand,
the crown is already open.
Seizing *qi* with the hand,
*qi* has never existed.
What thought touches
results in the bone’s opening and closing.
When *qi* attacks,
the body’s firmness and *qi*’s completeness—
why could they not be one?
Guiding and drawing *qi* generates *qi*,
*qi* generates essence and fluids,
essence and fluids generate spirit,
thus achieving longevity and clear vision.

Yellow Silk says:
The Heavenly Palace is in the crown—
yet it is not in the crown.
Within the crown is a palace,
named the Heavenly Palace.
The layered towers are in the lungs—
yet they are not in the lungs.
The Mysterious Capital is in the kidneys—
yet it is not in the kidneys.
The Yellow Court is in the spleen—
yet it is not in the spleen.
The Red Suspension is in the heart—
yet it is not in the heart.
The Azure Capital is in the liver—
yet it is not in the liver.
If they are not truly there,
then where do they reside?
Within the five contemplations,
thought truly arises.
The Hidden Heaven is in Heaven,
Heaven within Heaven.
The Concealed Earth is in Earth,
Earth within Earth.
The true forms of Heaven and Earth—
what other forms do they have?
Thus, the true forms of Heaven and Earth
are also generated by thought.
What thought generates
is originally complete and real.
Thus, the mind’s true contemplation
truly contains Heaven and Earth.

Yellow Silk says:
All beings of every kind
have not yet been born.
In the Northern Heaven, there are countless affections and desires,
thus there are Heavenly Palaces and Underworlds.
Egg-born, womb-born, damp-born, and transformed-born—
all arise from lewdness.
One must know that entanglement,
with love as its root.
With all false perceptions,
fostering attachment and affection,
thus the cycle of birth and death ensnares.
Desire arises from love,
life from desire’s attachment.
From desire’s thought,
all adverse and favorable circumstances arise.
Turning away from love,
anger and resentment emerge.
Creating countless evils—
this is the Underworld.
Knowing desire’s repugnance,
abandoning pleasure and fleeing evil,
thinking with goodness—
this is called *Jingming* (Pure Clarity).
Sealing the true mark in the Clear Bright Realm,
one attains the Dao.
All dharmas arise from original desire,
unfolding false perceptions,
thus generating afflictions.
From these afflictions,
one falls into birth and death,
manifesting the prisons of Heaven and Earth.
Thus, there are *Tángdū* demons devouring bodies—
all due to false union,
accumulating karmic offenses.
But if one awakens to *Jingming*,
entering the true mark of the Extreme,
first, one must take the vow,
achieving the Eight Extremes,
obtaining *Jingming*—
this is the true and real,
entering the Great Dao.

Yellow Silk says:
*Sincere loyalty* is the present meaning of *Jingming*.
To die for one’s body is filial piety—
this is *Jingming*’s benevolence.
To achieve a good name and purity—
this is *Jingming*;
To not covet profit or fame—
lawful forbearance is *Jingming*;
To not be rash in anger—
self-restraint is *Jingming*;
To act with reverence and caution—
tolerance is *Jingming*;
To be vast and luminous—
magnanimity is *Jingming*;
To rejoice in one’s portion—
forbearance is *Jingming*.
Hidden in illness,
within *Jingming*, the thought is true.

The thought, when kept pure,
has never failed to attain immortality.
Thus, those with *Jiawei*—
possess an unassailable countenance;
those who weep—
utter sounds that cannot be heard by others;
those who commune with ghosts and spirits in sacrifice—
all arise from this.

Yellow Silk says:
If thought is deemed delusion, who is without thought?
If thoughtlessness is true, who has thought?
If thought is delusion, how do you know?
If it is not, then it is not—it is not existence.
If thoughtlessness is not delusion, how do you know?
If it exists, then it is existence—knowing that non-existence is non-existence.
If non-existence is non-existence, then it is the law of *Jingming*.

A mirror reflects—water becomes that mirror,
and in water, *Jingming* is seen.

Yellow Silk says:
When facing the water’s reflection,
it only shows me—
not my true form—
thus, there is no true mirror.
If water reveals my true eyebrows, eyes, ears, and nose,
how do I know it is true?
You do not see the form—how do you know it is yours?
If you pinch your face with your hand,
the shadow in the mirror, the shadow in the water—
also shows the hand pinching the face.
If others do not pinch, they see no hand.
Thus, the hand is inherently mine, not theirs.
The hand is in me—
thus, this face is truly my face,
knowing the Eight Extremes through hand and face.
If it is in me, it is not the Eight Extremes;
if it is in another, it is not *Jingming*.

Yellow Silk says:
The origin of *Jingming* lies in true nature.
Within nature, there is function,
rooted in true thought.
Within thought, there is delusion—
thus, *Jingming* is lost.
Like a mirror in water,
if dust and filth obscure it,
it cannot reflect objects—
when objects obscure nature,
thought is not true,
and *Jingming* is lost.

---
**Volume Nine of the *Lingbao Jingming Huangsu* by the Highest Moon Palace, Taoyin Yuanjun, the Daoist King of Filial Piety, concludes.**
**Volume Ten of the *Lingbao Jingming Huangsu* begins.**

Yellow Silk says:
Parents are the *qi* of Heaven and Earth.
The sovereign is the Sun and Moon.
There has never been one who existed before Heaven and Earth, the Sun and Moon,
yet could act in the world.
Thus, the foundation of filial piety
scatters as loyalty and filiality.
The virtues of loyalty and filiality
are perfected in the Great Dao,
transcending the immortal realm—
thus, their rightness.

A person’s body is like Heaven and Earth.
Heaven and Earth as parents are like Original *Qi*.
The sovereign as Sun and Moon is like the heart and kidneys, ears and eyes.
There has never been one without these who could attain longevity—
it depends on steadfast loyalty and filiality.
Life is the Eight Extremes;
when the Eight Extremes are complete,
like a sturdy beam,
who could topple it?

Yellow Silk says:
*Xin* (faith) is *qi*.
A person’s *qi* flows continuously,
like the four seasons of Heaven—
breathing and pulse numbers—
if disrupted, it becomes illness.
Cold, heat, yin, and rain transform—
then disaster arises.
When a person lacks faith,
disaster and illness emerge.
Thus, beyond the Eight Extremes,
there is also faith.
Yang *qi* sprouts in the Yellow Bell organ—
faith arises within it.

Yellow Silk says:
The *Jing* (essence) of Yellow Silk has inner and outer aspects.
The inner *Jing* is clear and bright,
the outer *Jing* is luminous and transparent,
like a *liuli* (glazed) pearl—
also able to illuminate.
Like ice, clear and pure,
it melts and dissolves.

Yellow Silk says:
Those who know *Móming* (enlightenment)
are like casting a name into a *liuli* bottle—
visible both inside and out.

Yellow Silk says:
To study the Dao broadly,
broadness must be precise.
Once precise, one must know its principles.
Knowing the principles,
focus on what is essential.
Once the essential is grasped,
the Dao becomes easily known.

Yellow Silk says:
All under Heaven converges in unity—
attaining the hundred concerns.
The Dao is attained through unity—
there is no other way.
Like the paths of east, west, south, and north,
converging at the center.
Rivers and lakes,
all flow into the sea.

Yellow Silk says:
True nature is nature;
habit is not nature.
The ten habits are:
1. Lustful habit.
2. Greedy habit.
3. Arrogant habit.
4. Angry habit.
5. Deceitful habit.
6. Fraudulent habit.
7. Resentful habit.
8. Superficial habit.
9. Crooked habit.
10. Litigious habit.
When these ten habits are polished away,
the Dao of *Jingming* emerges.
If thought is impure,
the true is lost.
Losing the true,
true nature is obscured—
thus, *Jingming*’s principles are lost,
giving rise to false perceptions.

Yellow Silk says:
The Dao is originally empty yet real.
What is emptiness?
That which has no foundation is emptiness.
That which has a foundation is reality.
Heaven’s reality is in its height.
Earth’s reality is in its breadth.
Ghosts and spirits’ reality is in their numinousness.
The reality of *Jingming* is in *Jingming*—
thus, *Jingming* is reality.
Beyond true reality,
all else is illusory.
What is illusory?
If one takes intelligence as reality,
the Dao of *Jingming* cannot be founded upon it.
If one takes speech as reality,
the Dao of *Jingming* cannot be founded upon it.
If one takes cleverness and deceit as reality,
the Dao of *Jingming* cannot be founded upon it.
What can be relied upon
is what is practiced in true reality.

Yellow Silk says:
What is *shǒu* (guard)?
To guard in unity.
Unity is unchanging—
only the unchanging can transform endlessly;
one transformation leads to seven,
seven transformations lead to nine,
nine transformations return to unity.

Yellow Silk says:
The Dao is not distant—
it lies in the eyebrows and eyelashes.
The Dao is within—
in the chest and abdomen.

Yellow Silk says:
The Dao values essence,
essence lies in simplicity,
simplicity lies in detail,
detail lies in principles.
Thus, Yellow Silk is the framework of *Jingming*.
Like grasping the collar of a robe
to know the order of the collar and lining.

Yellow Silk says:
The three *Ling* (numinous) scriptures have a unified law.
The essential principle of the Supreme Sovereign
can be expressed in one phrase
to equal the three *Ling* scriptures.
If held steadfastly,
its efficacy is equal.
It can calm concerns and gather *shao* (summon),
concentrate the spirit and nurture the true—
this is essence and detail.

Incantation:
*Om* Sūluónà Sūlūsūshāfúhē.

The learned scholar, like holding a *lunzhū* (wheel-bead),
called the *jièzhū* (precept-bead),
from beginning to end—
the hundred spirits guard and the five *qi* settle,
inner thoughts cut off evil,
outerly welcoming the true—
this is called *Zǒng Xuán* (Total Mystery).

Yellow Silk says:
The *Jingming* (Pure Clarity) defense has a precept:
Hold the *shūzhū* (output-bead) and *lunzhū* (wheel-bead),
never release them without cause.
Maintain the right mindfulness
and return to right thought.
Before seeing the *bǎoyìn* (treasure-seal),
first perceive the *shūzhū*.
The *lunzhū* is boundless—
this is the *Jingming* method,
thus it can equal my mirror-water.
Mirror-water as the seat,
while the *shūzhū* moves and stops in accordance.

Yellow Silk says:
With the mirror reflecting form,
within form there is spirit.
With spirit merging with water,
within water there is the true.
Through prolonged practice,
one can see the numinous spirit
and repel demonic forces.

Yellow Silk says:
The *Yuāngāng* (Primordial Rigidity) flying spirit
must recognize the Dao’s pathways.
The *yángshén* (yang spirit) knowing the path
is how one attends the Primordial and does not err.

Yellow Silk says:
The *Yuāngāng* rigid path—
the *qi* of intersecting *gāng* (rigid lines).
Its firmness is like steel;
practiced long, one treads and ascends to empty space.
But with right thought,
leaping with both shoulders,
the spirit’s transformation comes naturally.

Yellow Silk says:
Heaven and Earth move the true,
the sun and moon move clarity,
the four seasons move sequence,
yin and yang move harmony.
When Heaven issues killing intent,
when Earth issues killing intent,
the sun and moon alternate with the four seasons,
yet the *wǔ* (martial) *yin-yang qi* alternate as dust.

Yellow Silk says:
Fortune and misfortune
are used to admonish the virtuous—
this is *pǐ* (stop).
Regret and hesitation
are used to clarify movement—
this is *zhǐ* (halt).
Disaster and filth
are used to repay the noble—
this is the petty.

Yellow Silk says:
The *língxiǎng* (numinous echoes)
are born from the heart.
When the heart reaches,
the numinous responds.
When the heart does not reach,
none can attain the numinous echoes.

Yellow Silk says:
The sun and moon in the sky—
their essence can be obtained and savored.
Yin and yang, formless—
their *qi* can be obtained and breathed.
Ghosts and spirits, most subtle—
their emotions and forms can be obtained and summoned.
This is the heart reaching,
and the numinous responding.

Yellow Silk says:
The Dao has a beginning and end,
yet its beginning cannot be exhausted.
Only because it cannot be exhausted,
does it begin at the beginning and end at the end.

*The Scripture of the Soul’s Treasure, Pure Clarity, Yellow Silk, Volume Ten, concludes.*

chunks.original_text: 高上月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素 书紫微右典者少微都录灵宝净明院司察右演教使傅飞卿解 经名：高上月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素书。 简称《净明黄素书》。 撰人不详，系宋元间净明派道经之一。 元人传飞注解。 十卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部方法类。 高上月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素书序例 序曰：太极无上始青之天，去日月之宫五千里，其有神机之道，分辟昭彰，未易区别。 天道复乎？ 此杳冥昏默，不可得而名也。 帝出震，是谓始青之天。 天造草昧，未周五行之数，不可得而见也。 故曰：去日月之宫五千里。 至阳之精为日，至阴之精为月，一阴一阳之谓道。 其明晦有时，其迟速有度。 神机之运，有阴阳不测者司之。 故曰：分辟昭彰，末易区别。 上帝悯生灵之夭折，故召日月二宫天尊，为说灵宝大法、黄素法、净明法、度人法各一也。 天地捆缢，万物化醇。 男女构精，万物化生。 莫非阴阳之冲炁也。 唯内伤於七精，外贼於六炁，於是阴阳之沴，致生灵有夭折之苦。 故上帝召日月二官天尊，谓非阴阳至精之炁，不足以回生起死，兴仆植僵，使之终年，而终寿域焉。 然灵宝大法者，道之宗也。 黄素法者，命之府也。 净明法者，性之本也。 度人法者，入道之门也。 道降而出其序，如此。 说法之时，众真群聚。

**Title:**
*The Highest Celestial Palace of the Moon, Supreme Dark Lord of Filial Dao, the Soul-Treasuring Immortal King’s Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence*
*(Commonly abbreviated as the *Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence*)*

**Author Unknown**, a Daoist scripture of the *Pure Clarity* sect from the Song-Yuan period.
Commentary by *Fei Fei* (傅飞), a Yuan-era transmission.
Ten volumes.
Source text: *Zhengtong Daozang*, *Dongxuan* (Mystic Primordial) section, *Methods* category.

---

**Preface to *The Highest Celestial Palace of the Moon, Supreme Dark Lord of Filial Dao, the Soul-Treasuring Immortal King’s Scripture of Pure Clarity and Yellow Essence***

The Preface states:

The **Supreme Ultimate**—the loftiest origin—is the **Azure Heaven** of the first beginning.
It lies **five thousand li** beyond the palaces of the Sun and Moon,
where the **divine mechanisms** of the Dao unfold in radiant distinction,
yet remain difficult to discern.

Does Heaven’s Way return?
This is the **dim and silent void**, beyond naming.

When the **Imperial Sovereign** issues the **Shocking** (震),
it is called the **Azure Heaven** of the first beginning.
Heaven’s creation was yet in **primordial chaos**,
before the Five Phases had fully manifested—
it could not yet be seen.

Thus it is said: **"Five thousand li beyond the palaces of the Sun and Moon."**

The **pure essence of the Sun** is the **Supreme Yang**,
the **pure essence of the Moon** is the **Supreme Yin**—
this interplay of **Yin and Yang** is the **Dao**.

Its waxing and waning have their seasons,
its swiftness and slowness follow their measures.
The **divine mechanisms** operate under the **unfathomable governance of Yin and Yang**.
Thus it is said: **"The divisions are manifest, yet not easily distinguished."**

The **Celestial Sovereign**, moved by pity for the **premature deaths** of living beings,
summoned the **Two Celestial Lords of the Sun and Moon Palaces**
to expound the **Four Great Methods**:
the **Soul-Treasuring Method (灵宝大法)**,
the **Yellow Essence Method (黄素法)**,
the **Pure Clarity Method (净明法)**,
and the **Method of Salvation (度人法)**—
each one in turn.

When **Heaven and Earth bind and restrain**,
all things refine into **purity**.
When **male and female merge their essences**,
all things generate anew—
none of this is without the **collision and transformation of Yin and Yang qi**.

Yet when **internal injury** strikes the **Seven Essences**,
and **external malevolence** assaults the **Six Qi**,
then the **plagues of Yin and Yang** take hold,
and living beings suffer the **misery of untimely death**.

Thus the **Celestial Sovereign** summoned the **Two Celestial Officials of the Sun and Moon**,
declaring that **only the most refined essence of Yin and Yang qi**
could **revive the dying, restore the fallen, and reanimate the stiffened**—
granting them **full years of life** and **eternal longevity**.

Yet among these, the **Soul-Treasuring Method** is the **root of the Dao**,
the **Yellow Essence Method** is the **repository of life**,
the **Pure Clarity Method** is the **source of innate nature**,
and the **Method of Salvation** is the **gateway to the Dao**.

The **Dao descends in its proper order**—
thus it is taught.

When the **Law** was expounded,
the **multitude of True Ones** gathered in assembly.

chunks.original_text: 道君宗王上帝，登洞神之室，坐玉局之座，敬授此书。 或於妄幻，以伪丧真。 还其本元，则真常存，故众真群聚。 然有真君存焉，道君宗王上帝是也。 洞如水之洞，无所不达。 神如火之传，无所不应。 登洞神之室，坐则道法之变化为无方。 坐玉局之座，则换阳精之纯而有体。 敬授此书，则奉而行之，其可忽乎。 其文皆广一丈，而此书，有黄素交光，垂芒照耀，映於月宫。 遂以此付之，故号月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素天尊。 而净明灵宝法，以付日宫太阳上帝孝道明王灵宝净明天尊。 《易》曰：物相杂，故曰文。 阴阳刚柔之炁交错而成文，则天地数周。 故其文，皆广长一丈，黄土之色，脾实主之。 素，金水之色，肾则主之。 受命之初，脾、肾为元炁、冲炁之本。 而胞胎孕育，寄於母身。 故黄素文交光，则映於月宫。 至於禀性受成，宴以父体故。 净明宝法，则以日宫太阳焉。 二书微妙，深不可晓。 可以报君父，可以成大药，可以伏灾魅。 见之者消屯，闻之者已疾，佩之者长生。 《冷明黄素书》，其理微，其道要，其义深而难知。 盖内者，外之符也。 一身者，天地之总钦。

chunks.original_text: 其天君顺其神，心推之於外，则忠孝可以报君父。 探取铅汞，抽添水火，验之於外，烹炼可以成。 药以火者，炁之反也。 而此导其常魅者，气之邪也。 而此复其正屯者，气之郁也。 故见通炁则消疾者，炁之淫也，故闻中炁则已。 至於能守统炁而不失，则虽与天地相为长久，可也。 故曰：佩之者，长生。 晓其义者得仙。 括阴阳造化之宜，明星辰交合之道。 南北之斗四旋，东西之分统制。 炁候交感，早晏分离。 自非已得 净明宝法者，未易能知也。 阴阳造化，以炁而感会也。 南北之斗回旋，以无而运行也。 东西之分统制，以炁而入也。 衍而伸之，亘古今而不穷。 总而会之，易岁月於时刻。 非穷理尽性，孰能与於此哉。 故曰：无候交感，早晏分离。 自非已得 净明宝法，末易能知也 黄帝素书人道品 凡学《黄素书》者，以五炁朝元，三阳聚项，或可飞升入圣，或可脱质升仙。 少年向慕千日，可以大成。 中年修持千日，亦可俯就。 晚年加进千日，尚可以立功。 诸弟子得法之后，以日月寸阴之借为性命，久长之计，莫先於此也。 人之初生，元气在脐。 而五行之气，散於五脏。 统以三宫，则丹田、绛宫、泥丸是也。 世之人，汩於嗜欲，收拾失宜，是以五炁散荡，而元炁沦亡。 升降乖离，而三宫阻绝。 驯致耗散，则天折随之矣。 学《黄素书》，务使五脏之炁，则朝於元，而金丹成就。 三宫之阳，皆聚於顶，而髓海充盈。 或飞举升真，神用无方，而入於圣焉。 或脱壳尸解，超离尘网，而升於仙焉。 少年炁血坚完，安而行之，可以大成。 中年熙血减耗，利而行之，亦故可以俯就。 晚年血炁既衰，强而行之，故尚可以立功。 必待千日之久者，盖数始於一，立於两，成於三。 积之三年，则历时而得数备，所以能成功也。 学者悟日月之跳，丸知寸阴之过隙者，宜玫力於斯焉。 凡学《黄素书》者，要在忠孝。 忠孝之人，持心直谅，秉炁温恭，是非不能摇，淫邪不可入，十善具备，五逆咸消，一心之中，外物不汩，自然成就，毕竟有成。 则黄素之士，以忠孝为本也。 况忠孝之人，内之事亲，外之事君，既无愧悚，可达幽明。 姓名已记，丹台功行，皆存紫籍。 兼之学道，可谓良金遇锻美玉，向镌鲜有不为令器者也。 忠孝之名，因君亲而立也，皆责於持心、直谅、秉熙、温恭。 然事公，以直谅为主。 事亲，以温恭为主。 直谅，则生明，故是非不能摇。 温恭，则生馑，故淫邪不可入。 由忠孝而推之，於临财，则为康。 形之於言，动，则为慎。 居之以宽裕，终之以容忍。 礼以节之，信以诚之。 则十善具备矣。 君臣有义，勿逆其经。 父子有亲，勿逆其分。 夫妇有别，勿逆其和睦之情。 长幼有序，勿逆其先后之礼。 朋友有信，勿逆其交际之心。 则五逆咸消矣。 一心湛然，如水澄 净，外物尘垢，何由汩之？ 则学道，其有不成乎。 《度人经》曰：诸天记人功过，毫分无失。 十善具备，五逆咸消矣。 则恶簿无姓，善簿有名。 丹台紫籍之所存记，复何疑也。 《礼》曰：玉不琢，不成器。 人不学，不知道。 《传》曰：若金在镕，唯冶者之所铸。 内行修明，而加之以学道，岂不犹良金美玉。 银之，以致利用，镌之，以文其美质。 干将、瑚琏，岂谓难成矣哉。

chunks.original_text: 今弟子有在公入仕者，有在仕为民者，有父母具庆者，有二亲丧亡者，有独养偏亲者，即当回思往昔，曲意追寻。 在仕路者，必须省其所以为仕。 在民力者，必须知其所以为民。 有父母者，知不报之恩而报。 有偏亲者，念死者而忧。 唯二亲丧亡，情不可堪。 回想昔时之有忤，当知今日之涕泪，报之不 可，旼之不可。 唯能知向道者有成，超脱尘录，名位出凡。 以此教人，人无不从。 推之天下，无不可也。 忠者钦之极，孝者顺之极，体钦顺而不失。 故在仕路者，风夜匪懈，以事其上。 宽慈惠和，以抚其下。 则知所以为仕矣。 用天之道，分地之利，谨身节用，以念君亲。 则知所以为民矣。 身体发肤，受之父母，欲报之德，昊天罔极。 孝子所以爱日者，思不报之恩而报故也。 无父何怙？ 无母何恃？ 出则御恤，入则靡至，既喜而惧继之者，念死者而忧故也。 《孝经》曰：立身行道，扬名於后世，以显父母，孝之终也。 永感之后，恩既不可报，死既不可旼。 若能向道有成，超脱尘录，而离乎数，名位出几，而列於仙，则孝道之终，孰大於是。 凡学《黄素》者，要在廉慎。 廉慎之人，无所贪欲，有所持守。 既无贪欲，乃有持守。 有持守，即无污辱。 无忿躁，斯无烦恼。 无烦恼，斯可修持。 既修持，则自然宽裕容忍。 以逸，以静，以虚，以安，以长久，以不变，然后有成也。 康者，见得而思义，故无贪欲。 慎者，言行不妄发，故有持守。 贪欲者，诱於外也。 持守者，立於内也。 与接为构，日以心斗，未有能执神而固也。 故曰：既无责欲，乃有持守。 恶醉而强酒者，不逃乎况湎。 亚心湿而居下者，未免乎沾濡。 故有持守，即无污辱。 三呼不闻，则必以恶声随之。 刻核太至，则必有不肖之心应之。 故无污辱，斯无忿躁。 利害相摩，生火甚多，众人焚和。 故无忿躁，斯无烦恼。 恬怆无为者，道德之本也。 凡学《黄素书》者，务在调其心性。 心性之用，象於鉴水，如彼应接，无嫌妍丑，不得方圆。 可住即住，可行即行，自然而已，则深得其妙也。 凡学《黄素书》者，既知立行，必学守持。 守持之术，当思一身何所从来？ 复何所从去？ 於来去之中，识其所以，自然通神，则仙道成矣。 凡学《黄素书》者，既知来去，必在勉力。 勉力非难，而所保之不变为难。 何谓保其不变之为难？ 衣食逼迫，贪心即随之，一也； 尊长约束，世事旋集，二也； 妻儿牵连，复忧过计，三也； 名利牵绊，不肯自己，四也； 疾病相煎，功未圆就，五也； 不慎择师，旋服未服，六也； 议论差别，又即生疑，不能专一，七也； 志意懈怠，始勤终忘，八也； 日月差互，不能成功，九也。 如此，皆令人中变。 凡遇此景，便须勉力向前，不求目前之事，则可以成矣。 凡学《黄素书》者，既得不变之道，而所以成就之者，亦有法。 何谓成就，知天地，知四时，知日月，知五行，辩水火，交龙虎，明丹砂药物，晓铅汞，会抽添、转河车。 然后，炼形之术，朝元之方，魔难之试，证验之悟，无不周矣。 凡学《黄素书》者，知成就者天地，而未知天地之妙。 何谓天地之妙？ 父母始生是也。 天黑下降，如父之精。 感地炁上腾，如母血之化。 感化之中，以有此身。

The body, flesh, and bones are received from one’s parents, and the debt of gratitude is boundless as the sky. Filial children cherish each day because they fear failing to repay this debt, even in death.
Without a father, where would one find refuge?
Without a mother, where would one find support?
When leaving home, they must protect against cold and heat;
When returning, they must guard against harm.
Those who, after joy, fear what follows—

*The Classic of Filial Piety* says:

With virtue upheld, there is no shame or defilement.
Without anger or agitation, one avoids suffering.
Without suffering, one can practice the Dao.
Once the Dao is practiced, one naturally becomes expansive and tolerant.
In ease, in stillness, in emptiness, in tranquility, in longevity, in constancy—
only then can success be achieved.

The contented see gain and ponder justice, thus having no greed.
The cautious speak and act without recklessness, thus maintaining virtue.
Greed is enticed by external things;
virtue is rooted in the self.
Interaction with others may lead to conflict,
and daily battles of the mind can never be won by clinging to the form.

Those who indulge in drink and force themselves to drink cannot escape **drunken excess**.
Those who dwell in damp, low places cannot avoid **moisture’s harm**.
Thus, with virtue upheld, there is no shame.

If three calls go unheeded, one must resort to harsh words.
If strictness is pushed too far, one will inevitably harbor resentment.
Thus, without shame, one avoids anger.

When profit and harm clash, flames arise abundantly,
and common folk are consumed by them.
Thus, without anger, one avoids suffering.

The serene and effortless are the foundation of **Daoist virtue**.
All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures* must focus on harmonizing their nature.
The nature’s operation mirrors still water:
like its reflections, it accepts all without favor,
yet cannot distinguish right from wrong.
Act when necessary, rest when necessary—
to follow this naturally is to grasp its essence.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they understand the principles of conduct, must also learn to guard them.
The method of guarding lies in contemplating:
where did this body originate?
Where will it return?
Within this coming and going,
if one recognizes its source,
one will naturally attain **spiritual insight**—
and thus the Dao of the immortals will be fulfilled.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they understand the origin and return, must strive with determination.
Striving is not difficult,
but preserving constancy is.
What is meant by the difficulty of preserving constancy?
When food and clothing press in, greed follows—**this is the first**.
When superiors impose restraints, worldly affairs swirl around—**this is the second**.
When children and spouse entangle one, worries and calculations arise—**this is the third**.
When fame and gain ensnare one, they refuse to let go—**this is the fourth**.
When illness torments one, their practice remains incomplete—**this is the fifth**.
When teachers are chosen carelessly, their methods are not properly absorbed—**this is the sixth**.
When debates arise, doubts multiply, and one cannot remain focused—**this is the seventh**.

When time slips away, success cannot be achieved—**this is the ninth**.
All these circumstances lead to **deviation from the Dao**.

When encountering such trials, one must persist with effort, seeking not immediate gratification, but ultimate fulfillment—
then success will be attained.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*, once they grasp the way of constancy, must also know the methods of attainment.
What is meant by attainment?
To know Heaven and Earth,
to know the Four Seasons,
to know the Sun and Moon,
to know the Five Phases,
to distinguish Water and Fire,
to harmonize Dragon and Tiger,
to understand alchemical medicines,
to master lead and mercury,
and to perfect the techniques of **distillation and sublimation**, as well as **revolving the cinnabar furnace**.

the trials of **demonic obstacles**,
and the enlightenment of **verification**—
all will be fully realized.

What are the mysteries of Heaven and Earth?

Heaven’s black essence descends like a father’s **vital seed**.
Earth’s **qi** ascends in response like a mother’s **transforming blood**.
Within this union,
this body is formed.»

chunks.original_text: 天地既长且久，则以运动、以静处有法，知静处运动，则知天地矣。 凡学《黄素书》者，知四时，而未知四时之机。 何谓四时之机？ 人寿百岁，自幼至壮，乃幼弱之时。 自壮至下寿六十，乃老耄至岁，乃衰败之时。 则一人之身，乃天地之时也。 故一身之时为难得，而日中之时又可惜。 知其机，则少年用功，知一身之时也。 寸阴不放，知日中之时也。 身中有年，年中用月，月中用日，日中用时，然后合於大道也。 凡学《黄素书》者，既知日月，必晓日月之数。 《清静经》曰：大道无形，生育天地。 大道无名，运行日月。 默记二仪，阴阳交合，助行昼夜之功。 故混沌初分，玄黄辨位。 天地之形，如合盂。 六合之中，如一卵。 日月之宫，随数上下，如人之魄魄。 故学者，以魂制魄，不可不知日月生没焉。 凡学《 黄素书》 者，既知五行。 而不知五行之宜。 相生相克，以为父子，以为夫妇，以为君臣、以为男女。 而人之五脏六腑，各以类推，而人之身，五行具焉。 凡学《黄素书》者，於五行之中，知水火矣。 而水火何以辨之，盖人之心、肾，相去八寸四分，乃水火定位之比也。 气液太源相合，乃水火交合之比也。 心生液，自肺液降於心。 液乃妇，有家也。 肾生气，自肾气行於心。 气乃男，有室也。 或自上而下，或自下而上，二炁相合，故曰真火、真水也。 凡学《黄素书》者，於水火之中，识龙虎之交。 何谓也？ 龙者，心也。 虎者，肾也。 肾炁易耗散，而真虎难得。 心液难积聚，而真龙易失。 要在知交合之时。 采取之法，有自火中出，有自水中生，而颠倒之术在也。 凡学《 黄素书》 者，既交合於龙虎，而丹药未易明也。 盖丹有内外，内丹者，其药材出於心肾，是人皆有，而必期於圣胎，就而真炁生。 炁中有炁，如龙之珠，如牛之黄，本於黄芽生。 内丹既成，则呵呼之间，可贮外药，则铅汞之合砂银之精是也。 凡学《黄素书》者，既交龙虎，辨药材，而於铅汞必有说焉。 砂中有汞，比於阳龙。 铅中之银，比於阴虎。 铅乃银之母，汞乃砂之子，铅汞相合，缎炼自成。 置之鼎器，配之药饵，温养无亏，则金丹可就矣。 凡学《黄素书》者，既知铅汞，必有抽添之法。 抽，则写之。 添，则补之。 补写之说，乃造化之本也。 是以天地，阴阳升降，而变六炁； 日月往复，而变九六。 如不达天地之机，则真铅一时飞散矣，当切记之。 凡学《黄素书》者，既审抽添之诀，必知河车之运。 何谓河车？ 有大河车，有小河车，有紫河车。 盖河车，北方之正炁，运转不已，而包含阴阳始之，匹配奇耦次也。 内则聚精神，然后采自然之药，进真炁之火，添汞抽铅，则小河车之事一也。 及夫一撞三关，直超内院，起收后前补炼上下，而黄庭大药渐成者，大河车之事也。 大小既运，功既圆就，形炁不亏，道既配合，则所谓紫河车。 足此三车，皆取意於运用而矣。 如此，则炼形，即元内观之术，皆在我也。 凡学《 黄素书》 者，既闻规戒，务在守持。 年光易如流，丸炁形消，如焚火流丸。 既落焚火，必灭。 各宜早下工夫，则便六亲和合，一人升陆，九族蒙恩。 凡自炁脉之原，必得亨通之路。 仙书在迩，各宜勉之。

as **father and son**,
as **husband and wife**,
as **lord and subject**,
as **male and female**.
The human **Five Zang and Six Fu organs**,
each correspond by analogy,

know **water and fire**.

The **kidneys** and **heart**,
eight inches and four divisions apart,
mark the **fixed positions of water and fire**.
The **vital essence (氣)** and **body fluids (液)**,
the **Great Sources** of **yin and yang**,
are the **interplay of water and fire**.
The **heart produces fluids**,

its **medicinal ingredients** arise from the **heart and kidneys**,
which all humans possess,
yet one must seek the **Sacred Embryo**,
whereby **True Qi** is generated.

like **Dragon’s Pearl** or **Ox’s Yellow**,
rooted in the **Primordial Yellow Sprout**.

one can **store external medicines** in the **breathing exercises (呵呼)**,

or the **refinement of cinnabar and silver essence**.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered the **union of Dragon and Tiger**,
and discriminated the **medicinal ingredients**,
must also explain the **nature of lead and mercury**.
Within **cinnabar**, there is **mercury**,
comparable to the **Yang Dragon**.
Within **lead**, the **silver essence**,
comparable to the **Yin Tiger**.

**mercury** is the **child** of **cinnabar**.

**sublimation (添)** means **to supplement**.
The **principles of extraction and supplementation**
are the **foundation of transformation**.
Thus, Heaven and Earth—
**yin and yang** ascending and descending—
**transform the Six Qi**.
The **sun and moon cycling**—
**transform the Nine and Six** (i.e., the **Nine Stars of the Sun and Six Stars of the Moon**).
If one does not grasp the **mechanism of Heaven and Earth**,
then **True Lead** will scatter in an instant.
This must be carefully remembered.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having mastered the **principles of distillation and sublimation**,
must also know the **operations of the Cinnabar Furnace (河车)**.
What is the **Cinnabar Furnace**?
There is the **Great Cinnabar Furnace**,
the **Small Cinnabar Furnace**,
and the **Purple Cinnabar Furnace**.
The **Cinnabar Furnace** is the **orthodox Qi of the North**,
constantly revolving,
encompassing the **beginning of yin and yang**,
and **matching odd and even pairs** in succession.
Internally, it **concentrates the spirit**,
then **harvests medicines from Nature**,
advances **True Qi’s Fire**,
**supplements mercury and extracts lead**,
and this is the **first matter of the Small Cinnabar Furnace**.
When one **passes the Three Passes with a single strike**,
directly transcending to the **Inner Palace**,
**retrieving and refining** the **posterior and anterior**,
**nurturing the upper and lower**,

this is the **Great Cinnabar Furnace**.

When the **Great and Small Cinnabar Furnaces** are both in operation,
and the **art is fully realized**,
the **form and Qi are unharmed**,
the **Dao is harmonized**,
then it is called the **Purple Cinnabar Furnace**.
With these **Three Furnaces** mastered,
all take meaning from the **operations of revolving**.
Thus, **refining the form**

all within oneself.

All who study *The Yellow and White Scriptures*,
having heard the **precepts and prohibitions**,

Time passes swiftly like a flowing stream,

From the **origin of the Qi and pulse pathways**,

when the heart thinks, the eyes see, the ears hear.
Naturally, their interplay is like sovereign and minister:
like minister bowing to sovereign,
the sovereign must answer in kind.
When man bows to **Spirit**, the **Spirit** responds likewise.

Though foul demons may lurk, unable to hide their forms,
if one’s **Spirit Essence** is vigorous,
evil cannot disrupt the upright.
Evil **qi** is absorbed by the **Heavenly Qi**,
so it abides—
in secret, aligning with the **Yellow-Subtle Cavern**’s vision method.
This is the **Golden Elixir** of **Day-Moon**’s radiance—
one’s **Inner Elixir** is near completion.

There has never been a fixed method for the **Yellow-Subtle Cavern**,
yet throughout life, one must never lose its nature.
This is not taught by a master.

A **child**—
one who does not spill.
Not spilling, so **Essence** thrives.
One who does not think—
not thinking, so **Spirit** gathers.
When **Spirit Essence** is complete,
it must be nourished.
The method of nourishment is **Fetal Breathing Qi**—
**Fetal Breathing**, the inhaling and exhaling,
with the left hand cradling the head,
the right hand cradling the feet.
Do not let the **Essence** scatter easily and be lost—
nor must one indulge in excess.
Man has **Upper, Middle, and Lower Elixir Fields**—
when **Essence** scatters and is lost,
the **Middle Elixir Field** is unstable,
and **Water** disrupts it.

Within **Elixir** lies **Elixir**,
within **Lead** lies **Lead**—
the **Heart-Kidney Fluids**.
Take one to draw the **Kidneys’ Essence**,
take two to draw the **Heart’s Essence**,
the **Heart-Kidney Odd-Paired Fluids**,
intermingling and uniting.
The two ears are the **Kidneys’ Gates**,
the two eyes are the **Heart’s Gate**.
With **Water** merging into **Fire**,
**Elixir** lies within **Water**.
When **Elixir** is within **Water**,
then the **Nasal Breathing Qi** regulates inhaling and exhaling.
The **Nose** is **Metal**,
the **Lungs** belong to **Metal**,
so the inhaling and exhaling through the nose
is named **Golden Elixir**.

Who can master the **North Dipper’s** true **Heavenly Qi**,
where the **Soul-Spirit** naturally does not stray west or east?
They guard the **South-North True Positions**,
to govern **Day-Moon**.
Those who push the **Heart** into the **Kidneys**—
the **Heart-Kidney Qi** flows in harmony.
The **Heart-Kidney**, when **Essence** is complete and **Spirit** is vigorous,
unite in their coupling.
When the **Heart-Kidney**’s union is precise and unerring,
then **Day-Moon** naturally shine.

To open **Eyes-Ears** is to harmonize the **Heart-Kidney Qi**.
The **Loyal**—
do not act rashly.
The **Filial**—
do not grieve in vain.
If one pushes and practices thus,
it is to serve the **Sovereign** and the **Father**.
If one guards and applies it,
then the **Heart** is the **Sovereign**,
the **Kidneys** are the **Father**.

These eleven chapters of **True Doctrine**,
one must ponder their meaning—
then the heart’s intent will naturally be clear,
the mind’s understanding will release the **Spirit**,
and the **Dao of Immortality** will be realized.

**Practice and Cultivation: Aligning with the **Spirit’s** True Doctrine** (Sanskrit: *Dhyāna*)
The **Central Yellow** generates the **True Colors**,
its position is inherently without deviation.
The four **qi**s unite harmoniously,
preserving me as I ascend to the **Mysterious Mysterious**.

The **Subtle Luminance** guards the **Elixir Chamber**,
the **Caverns** conceal without reckless emission.
The **Spirit’s** true form remains,
this is the method for eternal life.

The **Heart**’s **True Sovereign**,
capable of emitting the **Resplendent Light**.
Descending to merge with **Yellow-Subtle**,
encountering the **True Center**.
The **Green-White Qi**’s origin,
in peace, stabilizes **Yellow-Subtle**.

May I now practice this **Precious Method**,
to enter the path of **Ascending Immortality**.
These four chapters of **Sacred Verses**,
are the **True Spirit** of the five **Zang Organs**.

To practice **Yellow-Subtle**,
one must first engrave this text,
or inscribe it on one’s bedchamber—
then naturally, the five **Zang Organs’ Qi** will be seen,
and the incantation will be sung as such.

**The Sacred Scripture of the **Dark Palace’s** High **Lunar Sovereign**,
the **Filial Immortal King**,
the **Precious Treasure of Purity**,
the **Luminous Yellow-Subtle**—
**Chapter Five** ends.

**The Sacred Scripture of the **Dark Palace’s** High **Lunar Sovereign**,
the **Filial Immortal King**,
the **Precious Treasure of Purity**,
the **Luminous Yellow-Subtle**—
**Chapter Six** begins.

To learn **Yellow-Subtle**,
one must adjust and regulate the **Nodal Principles**,
the key is in **Harmony**.
Do not let **lustful, licentious thoughts and desires** arise,
the mind must be upright,
actions and stillness must not deceive.
For the **Soul** has never been unclean,
the **Spirit** has never been turbid—
when the clear and turbid intermingle,
then **Soul-Spirit** wage war.
The **Soul** does not accept what is upright,
the **Spirit** does not submit to control.
**Lustful desires** and **errant thoughts** drain the inner,
**gluttony and licentiousness** harm the outer.
**Spirit Essence** and **blood-qi** reside in the body,
yet there are subtle weeping and lamenting—
this must not be unknown to man.

Some say the **Dao of Immortality** is difficult,
yet it is not necessarily true.
The **Hell Realms** are mere empty words.
Even if one chases after life,
let alone the past—
this is the true folly of man.
Do you not see?
Even a **grass or tree**, without knowledge,
a **creeping insect**, most minute—
**Cinnamon** gains **Scallion** and becomes **Water**,
a **rat** gains **Croton seed** and grows fat—
none can transform without nourishment.
Now, man refines and ingests,
to attain **Immortality**—
this is its principle.

Again, there is **Master Dong**,
who with four **sutra**-verses:
"Make **ginger** not spicy,
and **salt** not salty."
He also uses **mantra** to influence things.
And there is **Ze Sheng**,
who can exhale **qi** to stop **Water**,
making it flow backward;
exhale **Fire**,
making it not burn.
Even the **Black Qi** can inhibit things.
Now, man recites **True Scripture** in the morning,
practices **mantra-qi** in the evening,
ingests and refines with method—
how can **Immortality** be unattainable?

Now, there are methods of **regulated eating**,
detailed below.

**The Method of Morning Hair-Combing**
In combing one’s hair,
must face east to preserve **Green Qi**.
First, use the left hand to grasp the hair,
the right hand to hold the comb,
imagining as if within **Green Clouds** there is **Mysterious Thread**.
Recite the **mantra**:
*"The **Great Summit** scatters its **Spirit**,
hair becomes **Green Cloud**.
I now comb my hair,
to preserve **Eternal Life**."*

This hair-combing must not leave the bedchamber—
comb in one place.
The **East** is where **Life-Giving Qi** originates,
**Wood** governs **spreading and flourishing**.
Man’s hair and fur,
like **grass and trees**’ branches and leaves,
thus its method is to face **East**,
and preserve **Green Cloud**.

**The Method of Clothing**
Clothing must be donned toward the **Moon’s Direction**.
The **mantra** says:
*"Heaven bestows **Golden Thread Clothing**,
**Golden Clothing** fits when worn.
Warmth is regulated with moderation,
wearing it, disease departs."*

This method of clothing,
preserves as if the **Five-Colored Clouds** cover the body.
The **Moon’s Direction** is where the **Ladle Star** points.
Upon rising and dressing,
one must follow the **Moon’s Direction**.
Preserve the **Five-Colored Clouds**,
taking the **qi** of the five **Phases** to envelop the four limbs.»

I purge the rotten remains, lest they harm the spirit.

When using the toilet, avoid doing so beneath the sun, moon, stars, or constellations, nor facing east or northeast.

When lying down, one must face east or south to align with the convergence of the two *dou* (cosmic poles).

*"The Five Celestial Guards and the Spirit **Qi** enfold my body,

East and south are where the **yang qi** resides.

**End of the Sixth Volume of *The Yellow Silk Scripture of the Highest Purity and Divine Treasure of the Moon Palace’s Sovereign, the Mother of Great Darkness***

**Seventh Volume of *The Yellow Silk Scripture of the Highest Purity and Divine Treasure of the Moon Palace’s Sovereign, the Mother of Great Darkness***

The **spleen** is the central sovereign, governing the **zàng**-organs’ **zhèng qi** (true **qi**).
The **lungs** are the general, commanding the five **qi**’s breath.
If breath falters even once, illness arises; if **qi** does not generate, death follows.
Thus, the **lungs** must cover above, and the **spleen** must support below—this is the fundamental principle of the *Yellow Silk Scripture*.
At the hours of *zi* (11 PM–1 AM) and *wu* (11 AM–1 PM), visualize a child holding a yellow banner within the **spleen** and **lungs**.
If **white qi** appears, like wind stirring the banner,
close the breath and focus the mind—then all distractions will cease.
The five **zàng**-organs all nourish **essence** and **qi**, yet here the emphasis lies on the **spleen** and **lungs**.
The **heart** and **kidneys** are husband and wife,
while the **spleen** and **lungs** are mother and child.
Only after mother and child nourish each other does the father-son relationship arise—thus the **liver** generates, and the **liver** gives birth to the **heart**.
The **heart** is the sovereign; thus, this is the **Dao** of lord and minister, preserved in sequence.

Heaven is high, Earth is low; the three **yin** and three **yang** circulate within.
In one’s body, **yin** and **yang qi** flow through.
Harmony brings peace; imbalance brings illness.
Thus, when cold or heat overpowers, it becomes *nuè* (malaria-like fever) or *lì* (severe cold).
If **yang qi** is excessive while **yin** is suppressed, it becomes *lì*.
If **yang qi** is suppressed while **yin** is excessive, it becomes *wēn* (epidemic disease).
If **yang qi** is stagnant and does not circulate, it becomes *jū* (ulcerous sores).
If blood and **qi** are blocked, it becomes *yǒu* (a wasting disease).
All these manifest as bear-like afflictions, threatening life itself.

Many know how illness harms, yet few grasp cultivation to achieve longevity.
They see distant threats yet fail to observe those near at hand.
If you cover one eye, you cannot see.
If you pinch one ear, you cannot hear.
If you hold your breath, internal **qi** cannot escape.
If you sneeze, external **qi** cannot enter.
Understanding this, how can you doubt that focusing the mind and calling **qi** can bring harmony?

Only by mastering focused contemplation and **qi**-invocation can one grasp the *Yellow Silk Scripture*’s true essence.
What is the true essence?
All else is not the true essence.
The eyes perceive color, the ears hear sound, the nose smells fragrance, the mouth tastes flavor—
lust for clothing, money, or filth; or entanglement in debauchery and deceit—
all arise from imagination.
If you focus correctly, what you attain will also be effortless.
Thus, the **Dao** of *Yellow Silk Scripture* is easier than pursuing the pleasures of the eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.
Those who attain this **Dao** will prevail.

What does it mean to prevail?
No one does not desire longevity, yet this method can grant it.
No one does not desire divinity, yet this method can achieve it.
Thus, the **Dao** of longevity and immortality lies not in idle thought but in focused contemplation to align with the true essence.

The **Dao** is without contemplation or action.
Without contemplation does not mean one never contemplates—
contemplation is the rectification of nature.
Without action does not mean one never acts—
action is the fulfillment of principle.
If one insists on "without contemplation," they are no better than beasts.
If one insists on "without action," they are no better than stone.
To mistake beasts and stone for the **Dao**, saying,
*"I have no contemplation; I have no action,"*
is false.

Now, if a person sits in a grand hall,
fire rising from above—they will flee;
water overflowing from below—they will flee.
If they do not flee, it is because they discern whether the threat is true or false.
If they can discern correctly, they must say:
*"Fire and water approach, threatening my life—I must flee!"*
Yet if the **Dao** is claimed to be without contemplation or action,
while also relying on focused visualization and **qi**-invocation,
this is a contradiction—and it is not so.

Thus, the mind feels, the spirit condenses, the **qi** interacts, and sincerity is achieved.
What is *feeling*?
It is responding to sound.
What is *condensing*?
It is focusing on one thing and becoming still.
What is *interacting*?
It is stillness that allows interaction.
What is *achieving*?
It is interaction that brings fulfillment.

For the silent morning audience method of communicating with the heavens,
this principle applies—then the soul and spirit will not wander,
and the audience will not be lost.
If, during this time, a boy stands beside you,
striking the *zhèng* (metallophone) or walking in empty space,
and your spirit rises with the sound,
then upon returning, it will also seek the sound—
this is the supreme method.

These techniques vary widely, yet beyond them lies an essential truth.
Now, many cultivate the **Dao** and seek the spirit,
yet they only refine **yin qi**—like the *Yuángāng* (primordial **qi**) walking method.
Within *Yuángāng*, there is also the method of **yang qi**.
Directly within the physical form, its benefits are immediate,
though refining **yin qi** for ten years is still difficult.
Methods like the *Rìyuè Jié Lún Gāoběn* (sun-moon purification of the essence’s foundation) are **yang**-based,
requiring deep familiarity—if not, one will be attached to other practices.

Few can ascend and transform, yet many can shed their bones.
At the moment of shedding bones,
one must be thoroughly familiar with the *Yuángāng* walking method,
the palace courts and morning audiences,
and the proper responses to the celestial throne.
Ignorance here will invite the *Luóxiá* (demons) and a hundred ghosts
to deceive and ensnare you within the realm.
Only those who recognize this danger will succeed.

chunks.original_text: 目圆者，即恶鬼也。 吾心知，则鬼神亦怖死矣。 闻见鬼神，要在审察。 清灵之鬼，伪作真仙，指迷为正，说是为非，最误后学。 唯想识正直，则可以辩。 鬓发青绀，面红眼方，真神人高真也。 一有缺之，未为是也。 当此时，有正念，则邪魔退伏矣。 高上月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素书卷之七竟 高上月宫太阴元君孝道仙王灵宝净明黄素书卷之八 黄素内经上 神宫巍巍昆仑上，昆仑山下双连湾。 清浊之炁分玄黄，玄黄之炁定圆方。 二炁交感生阴阳，阴阳魂魄照中堂。 采之有术在心王，想之既熟为膏粱。 不必五谷藏府安，食之既久可安康。 龙车凤辈入圆光，一一图诀宫中安。 阳帝阴童稽首尊，七七之炁精神通。 复上车轮还本宫，自然道备飞虚空。 黄素内经中 夫妇之妙有元功，一吸一嘘生炁浓。 合口细咽如云风，甘如酥乳罗心胸。 自然饱满精神雄，兼以大药相扶养。 养就炁血两脸红，不食五谷吞云风。 五谷本是养炁血，七日不食人道穷。 先生绝之必有道，以之顿渐相磨珑。 松栢胡麻炁味融，山木余粮能守中。 必日食炁炁虚空，大丹可以成元功。 黄素内经下 人道大丹非可致，欲成大丹以功智。 五藏不在无滓秽，要在神完精炁秘。 精全神旺保百世，自然心与神明契。 一切学者会以意，非在绝食而吞炁。 绝食吞炁早成仙，成仙慎欲有大缘。 不然自是能长命，长命之药堪延年。 山木细涤以水煎，蜂密百炼以为丸。 如得之要助炁全，绝食可以形超然。 黄素外经上 园桂导达五味师，可理五炁生英资。 御除秽沫除蛟璃，却老延年最为奇。 出水入火甚稀奇，细嚼咽津兼入驰。 五云相合更相宜，饮啄自绝且不饥。 长得饱满无倾危，更能栢叶传使之。 全胜取津向华池，添得元精归四肢。 黄素外经中 心神妄念曷止之，道书灵药固相宜。 细嚼胡麻细咽之，可以熏润除三尸。 心不生妄尸不归，自然魂魄无东西。 久则念绝浑忘之，或以茯菟消作糜。 或以麦芙咀其脂，可使神永咽华池。 不令贪涎生祸基，服饵之卫须寻披。 大丹之力须扶持。 黄素外经下 不学断谷不飞升，断谷之中炁最灵。 且无粳稻邪魔腥，自有正味归中庭。 十年之中天厨灵，早暮络绎送馐珍。 况复省欲可固精，不慕三厌与五辛。 太上之药着前经，更有祭法须荤腥。 用以辟除九等神，九等之神如虫形。 以荤和药消其形，茯苓胡麻二物精。 和作淡面向清晨，每以一剂向一旬。 一剂九等皆消冰。 黄素曰：断谷不能长生，而可以通神得仙。 得仙须欲有功，有功须欲有年，是以饵药期长生，断谷冀升仙。 功能在双积，行艺须两全。 忠孝藏心知，服炼以全行。 修持无懈怠，一跃归青天。 升法实有法，不在身飞腾。 飞腾捧丹诏，方名为大仙。 如只善升举，此名空行仙。 乘娇与乘假，此察吾之功。 黄素曰：正真之道，本由心想。 诸色邪见，亦自心生。 只如绝食，累年不饥。 七日不食，得疾便死。 人可以累年不饥，亦可以七日致死。 生死虽异，其法本同。 不饥不想，出自正真。 神符咒水，亦由念虑。 精神配合，自然充盈。 致死之思，出乎邪见。 五味馨香，贪涎流溢。 精神荡散，使之饥渴。 盖人之动止，有妄有真，不可不慎。 譬之以手作拳，手发劳想，自然有汁。 以汗本自手出，则未握时，本无有汗。

The divine palace looms atop Kunlun’s peak,
Beneath Kunlun’s mountain, the Double Bay flows.

The marvel of husband and wife lies in primal function,
One inhalation, one exhalation—*qi* grows dense.
Seal the lips, swallow gently like wind through clouds,

Naturally plump with spirited vigor,

Seven days without them exhausts human fate.
The Master abstains—there must be method,
Gradual and sudden techniques honed together.
Pine, cypress, hempseed—*qi* flavors blend,
Mountain grains and surplus stores preserve the center.
Must daily consume *qi* to fill the void,
Only then can the great elixir perfect primal function.

Human elixir cannot be forced—

The five viscera need no filth to cleanse,

Naturally, heart and spirit align.
All learners must unite in intent,

Swallowing *qi* after fasting—quick ascension,

Growing plump without peril, branches and leaves transmit essence.

Guarding elixirs requires careful seeking.
